text: Always when I come to Vegas I try to stop by and get something to eat. This time the Lady at the counter was terrible.Didn't care about whether we were ordering food or not  she was busy watching the TV. When I was ordering I had to repeat my order a couple times because her focus was on the Hispanic news channel. Do you know how annoying that is? Tables were not  clean and there's food & paper on the floor. Foods gone south like the customer service. Sorry last time eating here for me and my family.

First time here and really nicely surprised. I needed $8 for a decent late night meal with some red medium hot sauce on it. The corn tortilla definitely impressed me with strong, specific corn flavour and taste. Actually, I was in a hurry and was not sure what to take from the menu. 
The guy behind the counter gave me full info about the food and how to time it takes to be prepared. Well, just helpful and friendly staff that works very fast on the orders.  Proper selection of soft drinks.
This place sucks with horrible employees that have horrible costumer service. Learn how to treat ALL YOUR COSTUMERS RIGHT NOT JUST LATINOS.
The food is cosi cosi (so so), but I come here on occassion because its close to home and theyre open 24hrs.  I do wonder sometimes how long certain ingredients have been sitting :/

I like the fact that this establishment is open 24/7 and I like the salsa bar and juice fountain machine.  The #1 combo was tasty too.

I have to be honest though,  as someone who does not speak Spanish,  I had difficulty communicating with the cashier. Three examples:

1) I almost never have cash on me, so I asked if there is a minimum on cards (ex. Some restaurants have a $10 minimum when using credit cards).  The cashier "yes, debit-credit okay."
2) "Can you do take-out?" Blank stare... "To-go?" Nervous smile... "Take-away?" The cashier sighs in frustration trying to decode my question.  I ended up playing charades to get my answer.
3) I asked if the combos come with a drink. At this point,  I am this poor cashier's worst nightmare with all of my questions. 

What I have learned: no credit card minimums, I can place to-go orders and you have to order drinks separately. I would come here again (language barrier aside, the cashier was polite).

SHOULD BE NO STARS, ONCE AGAIN.

My family has frequented this location several times.  Usually, we order quite a few things, however, I came from across Taco Bell because my little one wanted rolled tacos.  Also, maybe I was able to catch this mistake because I only ordered one plate, instead ordering several items and never catching it before.

I placed an order for #1 which is rolled tacos, rice and beans.  The order should have been $5.75 and tax, however, I gave my debit card and was charged $8.16.  When I got home, I checked the receipt and noticed I was charged for #11 which was $7.55 and with tax, came to $8.16.

I am not hispanic, however, I do know when the clerk turned around and told the cook "numero 1, pollo) I thought I was getting charged for the correct combo, not being overcharged for something I never ordered.  I was quite surprised my order was correct, just not the pricing.

The next morning I called the restaurant and was told Manwell was the manager and to get a hold of him I would have to call around 7:00 a.m. to get a hold of him.  I tried this morning and got several people who could not understand me to finally find someone who could speak to me in English to tell me his name is Javier and he was the manager.  When I informed him I was told Manwell was the manager, he told me to call back in a couple hours.

I have yet to speak to the manager, yet; however, I need to know if this is normal practice to overcharge customers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Better than Roberto's for sure.  At least they let you customize your burrito to your liking.
Good Mexican food, I usually stick with the basics , carne asada burrito or quesildia, or tacos... They also have good rice pudding for dessert

This is for the menudo and excellent service I received today. So I came by and planned on ordering two breakfast burritos but saw that they also had menudo. I was like shoots! It's been a minute since I ate menudo. I must say that it was deliciouso! I killed the entire bowl! It was that good. One of the ladies working during Easter said that they have tried many chilies and the one that was perfect and tasted the best was from Mexico. So now you know. When they make there menudo, they are getting some of the best tasting red chilies to make their bomb menudo! I'm most def a fan!
They're closed. Supposed to be 24/7. Bologna. They're sign days 24/7 they have never been closed before and it isn't a holiday. Bad workers.
Muy mal... stood there waiting for so long before being able to place my order, that i think the cook wanted to come around to take it! Food wasnt that good either.

Wanted carne asada fries and tried it here first.
Was satisfied and thought the portion was big enough.
The best Mexican food in town. The best customer service doesn't get any better then this.

Worse chorizo burrito ever!!!  Not sure if I'll give it another try but chorizo burrito are a staple breakfast meal in the Mexican culture.  This one was not even edible, I threw over half of it away.  Rather drive out of my way then eat here again.

My office had lunch from there today. I've been vomiting all afternoon almost immediately after eating my office manager had diarrhea and the others have taken tums and is fitting the urge of expelling their lunch.

I would rather subject myself to Taco Bell rather than eat at this place! Ha! All kidding aside this place is pretty terrible. I called and placed an order for pickup and I was very glad they had it ready to go upon arrival. The prices are fair but not once you try the food. 
   I ordered a Carne Asada Torta and a Carnitas burrito, both were literally inedible.i am not a picky eater, I can eat pretty much eat anything but this was garbage! The carne asada was very cold and the avacado was watery. The carnitas burrito looked very stale and the meat was dry. The burrito was also cold and the salsa was just red water. Both my gf and I could not eat the food so unfortunately we had to toss it. 
We live right across the street from the place so it's not like we let it get cold. We also picked it up in five minutes since that was their estimate.
  I highly recommend you stay away or go to Don Tortaco on Rainbow.

Came into this establishment with my service dog! Was refused service when asked to show documention for her being a service dog! Will not be coming back to contribute money to this place of business that refused me service due to showing documents! You should teach your employees the laws of what they can and can't ask for. Called to speak to the manager after of which she said the health dept. Told employees to ask to see  documents of the service dog. Of which seems ridiculous, I'm sure the health dept. Knows what you can and can't ask for and the laws surrounding a service animal.

If I could give this place 0 I would the lady that says she's the manager took my order I ordered 3 breakfast burritos one with no sausage add carne Sada went back to get my order fixed the lady that works there claimed to be a manager and didn't want to make me the food the right way so I had to sit there and argue with her for 20 minutes before I got my money back. No customer service skills at all...

Fast, fresh, & always service with a smile. 
This what brings me back here.
For when you just don't feel like cooking, this is a great substitute without the fuss & mess.

Called in to order and the lady totally forgot. So I still had to wait for my food the entire time which defeated the purpose of me calling in. Food is average, it's like any Don Tortaco/Roberto's out there. I still come here though since it's a convenient location right next to the S Jones exit of the 215. It's also 24 hours so it's very useful.

If loving Don Tortaco is wrong than I don't wanna be right!

There. I said it. I'm not even ashamed I said it, either!

This location can be found on Jones just south of the 215. It is in the same plaza as Taco Bell, right next door to a Liquor store. 

I was a frequent visitor of DT in my previous neighborhood, so all I can really do is compare this location to that one on Maryland Parkway and Windmill. 

so, here goes..

-this location has a much nicer dining area than the Maryland Parkway location. I can actually see myself taking one in here sometime, where as the other location was strictly a grab and go place.

- they seem to be a lot busier here! I never walked into the other location to see a line 6 people deep! That being said, they really worked through the line fast! They were hustling here!

- the parking situation is atrocious here! If it is busy at all, good luck finding a space! I never encountered that problem at the other location. Not even once.

- the food its self: I never complained about portion size at the last location, but so far both visits here the portions have been ginormous! HUGE! Plus it is the same reliable yummy food I have come to expect from Don Tortaco.

If anything I am going to have to exhibit a little self control with the carne asada and breakfast burritos before I develop a little buddha belly!

I like this place. I will be back. Probably a lot.

4 stars.

I was pleasantly surprised! I went there at 6am 8/31/17 and the young lady and the cook that work the 12-8am were very friendly as well as awesome customer service. Loved the food and very fresh!!! I will be back.
Worst experience ever, I practically had to beg the cashier for my receipt.  To bad that her fragile guest service experience affects the restaurants overall grade.  Never again
The food is great, the service is phenomenal and the chocoflan is to die for no literally, bail me out cause I will kill for this stuff

They recently changed the name of this place to Don Chuy's.  I wasn't fond of this place when it was Don Tortaco.  I thought Roberto's was much better.  I walked in and the woman at the counter just scowled at me and asked me for my order in Spanish.  I understand Spanish, so I do not care about that, but a guy came up behind her and told her that he would wait on me. Anyway, I ordered a California Burrito with no pico.  A normal California Burrito has steak, French Fries, cheddar cheese and pico.  However when I got the burrito, it didn't have the pico which was good.  However, it had no cheese and the fries were half cooked.  And the cook kept on asking the clerk questions about the orders.  It also took a lot longer than Roberto's.  The best thing that I can say about the place is that it was clean.  Otherwise I would avoid this location.

Liked it better before. I use to live in the neighborhood and went there a lot. Now I went to this new name and even though it looks the same the food was so greasy that made me sick. Service was good and fast.

I went to this place three times. I keep giving them a chance but I most likely will not come here again. The food is okay, I feel like their food had more flavor when it was still Roberto's. With all my three experiences I encountered really bad manners from the staff. One of the older ladies who took our order seemed like she didn't want to take our order. While she was waiting for us to order, she was scratching off a piece of food off the register counter with someones credit card.

Best Mexican fast food joint in west Las Vegas. 
This location is the only one. They used to be a franchise of Don Tortaco but they bought their business back from the chain and it's now a small family business. 
You can taste the family difference here!
Everything tastes so much better here and fresher too. Won't touch Don Tortaco or Robertos anymore. 
Something about their Carne Asada is 

They're open 24/7 and they're super friendly. 
Support this small business with your late night Mexican cravings! They won't disappoint!

First visit: Chicken chimi & rolled tacos. OK. Place is clean, new, and staff very nice. Place quick...not fast food quality...better than a taco bell but little bland, salsa OK and not many options. Chimichanga good but rolled tacos had little meat. Beans excellent but could use some seasoning. Rice boring. Needs spice. Maybe I will come back but chili verde express is way better.

Second visit: Carne burrito/carne taco/carnita taco. Flavor better than chicken. Add fresh lime..much better. Still clean, fast, and OK in a pinch.

I used to come here all the time until don chuy bought the place.  Now they make mistakes all the time.  I simply came in today for a breakfast burrito.  I asked 3 times for the burrito to be grilled well after they wrap it.  They did the opposite of what I asked and barely grilled the burrito and it tasted crappy.  I called them up to let them know they forgot to grill the burrito even though I asked 3 times.  The person on the phone said he was an owner and did don't want my business if I had. Any requests.  He actually told me to go elsewhere.  I'll happily go to Don Tortacos a block over on Rainbow.  I'm also letting all the people that work for me know how horrible the customer service is there.  I buy Mexican for them all the time but now Don Chuy will get no business from me or any of my 150 employees.  SMART MOVE DON CHUYS!!!   Horrible attitude from the supposed owner just for a simple request.  And they had no customers there.
GO ELSEWHERE!!

Like most normal human beings I love Robertos!! This place is basically that with a different name?? Whatever I'm not impressed, it wasn't a terrible experience I guess but a series of frustrating events.. We placed the order, they got it wrong, we asked them to fix it they got it wrong again blughhh no thank you

Nice little Mexican place in the far southwest part of town.  If you live in the area it is fine to go to but I would not suggest really going out of your way to go to it.  Not much difference between a Roberto's or a Don Tortaco as not only the menu and prices are very comparable but the menu board looks like it came from the same production company!  24 hours is nice though.

Don't get me wrong, I love this place. And I love that it's 24 hours (it's also super close to my house, score~!). But I'm starting to get really pissed off. Every time I go in there (I order the same thing every time), I ask for a burrito "and can you add all the extras to it please?" (I'm not painting myself in a better light here, working in customer service in my teen years has trained me to always be polite). Without fail, the girl (always a different girl so far) will always look at me SUPER confused like she's NEVER seen the menu before in her life. The menu is simple: tacos, burritos, etc... And then "extras" to add to your main dish (there's also extra sides, so maybe that's the confusion?). No matter how good her English is, I have to point to the God damn menu and go "extras please" and she'll ask about them all. One. By. One. "Rice?" Yes.. "Guac?" Yes.. "Salsa?" ALL OF THEM, DID I STUTTER? Due to my crankiness after a 12 hour shift last night, I didn't care to go through this dance again, I sent my boyfriend and he told her the same thing "all the extras added, please". She was confused. Clearly, because when he got home my burrito (which I've been looking forward to ALL week for my diet cheat day) had nothing but meat and cheese in it. It was not a burrito. It was a sticky meat tube. His burrito came out perfect by the way, how did she get one and not the other?!?! My cheat day was ruined. I can't just get another one the next day because they're HUUUUGE (my inner fat kid is usually delighted by this fact). Can't eat that more than once a week, no sir. 

Like I said, I love the food, I love the place. But these are some of the dumbest, most unaware, fucking oblivious cashier girls I've ever encountered. At the very least, I did some math and found out that I wasn't charged for the extras I requested and didn't receive, so that's nice at least. Next time, I plan to just silently give her a written list. Can't screw it up if it's right in front of you, right? .... Right? 

I want to give you five stars so bad, I really do.

We live down the street, so we gave it a try. I'm not sure the connection with Roberto's, Don Tortaco, or any of the others, but they all have the same menu, and everything is served the same... 

This is BY FAR, the best tasting food of this type of chain. (I don't know for sure if there's a connection, but seems like it). Food ALWAYS fresh, cashiers are always friendly, and fast. Although it's seemingly the same food as the places I listed, this location is definitely the tastiest.
The food is excellent and the place is really clean. Finally found a good Mexican restaurant to eat at close to the house. Cheers
Bad customer service. Felt obligated to buy food in order to use the restroom. I've never had to do that in the past 4 years that I have been coming to this restaurant.
This place has the best chicken tacos and the price is great.  Go on Wednesday and get them for 99 cents.  GREAT FOOD!

Conveniently located off the I-215 on S Jones Blvd.
Food is totally a hit or miss, depending what time of the day it is.
I had very mixed experiences here. I think they changed the sauce. I used to like it before, and not so much anymore.
Fortunately, the items I always order, pretty good!
Chicken enchiladas with rice.
Chicken chimichanga with rice.
Carne asada burrito. 
The complementary vegetable bar is always full, and the vegetables are always fresh!
I also like their cheesecake.
My BF is trilled to have their mexican coca cola!
Service is pretty fast. 
Easy to order, pay and pick up food. If you are eating there, they are bringing the food to your table, too.
The food is good but the service is horrible. The girl at the counter always has an attitude when we come in and if I order to go over the phone, I'm hung up on. Good thing I like the food ..

The staff here is super nice! The food is some of the best on this side of town. This location is better than other ones close by and cleaner. 

I love the breakfast burrito with bacon so bomb!!

You only need to know one thing . . . bacon breakfast burrito or "Bacon Burrito" for short. There's nothing skimpy about this burrito stuffed full of eggs, cheese, potato, and bacon. The secret is they deep fry the bacon. After one of these, I can't eat for 24hrs I'm so full.

Service here has always been top notch work no problems. Food quality and temperature is always excellent too. Pickled vegetables and salsa is consistent but green onions are hit or miss. I eat here primarily for lunch and sometimes breakfast. There's always a steady stream on contractors eating in our carrying out food. That tells me this is a good place to eat. My stomach tells me that every time I eat here too.

Yes, it was a Roberto's then a Don Tortaco. Both are franchises. Don Chuy is the same owners going independent.
Clean and friendly staff!!! Food is always fresh and delicious!! I come here almost every morning for breakfast.
Had carne asada fries. Portion was enough for 2 people. No other sides needed. Clean place. Food taste good. I would come back. They don't take all credit cards. Open 24hrs which makes it convenient.
I love their carne asada fries! Champurrado was delicious and portions are great!

Not sure how I got here, but decided to be adventures today. 

This place is a 4 stars spot, not so much for the food, but mostly for the service. 

The girl at the register (Alejandra) literally takes care of the place. She does everything! And with a huge smile on her face. I was very impressed with the way she dealt with the customers, orders, kitchen. 

The food pretty good. I got the chicken burrito with the combo. Chicken was good, probably little bit too much sour cream for me inside. Rice were decent and the beans were tasty. 

The place was busy when I sat there! 

Food 3 stars, but experience definitely more than that. 
Trust me. I know food.

I dislike it when people try to give these mediocre establishments a horrible rating for service or food quality..here's the bottom line you get what you pay for so people you are acting snobby when you're trying to give a review for this place. Basic Mexican food but I will tell something that stands out here..they offer desserts like tres leches and chocolate flan..amazing desserts so expect decent Mexican food. Great desserts bad service depending on whose working.

My go to items..
Bacon breakfast burrito
Carne asada nachos or plate
Chimichangas
Fish tacos 
Shrimp tacos

Called in the order to go. Order was ready before projected time. The store is very nice, nicest taco shop I have ever been to. And I wish I knew the guys name... Customer service was amazing. Employees were happy and energetic

This review applies only to the breakfast burritos, I have not tried any of the other dishes.  I am a breakfast enthusiast, breakfast burritos being my greatest weakness.  The breakfast burritos are large, filled with the right proportion of potato, meat, and eggs.  Service is always friendly and fast, I can be in and out within 5 minutes with a hot fresh burrito and on time for work. Love the fresh green sauce as well.
Pretty damn good! I had the Breakfast burrito and it was major cheaper then Robertos expensive ass burritos. they raised there prices so high. Im not going there any more im hitting up Chuy spot.

First visit at this dump after craving Mexican food. Such a bland taste. Not recommended at all. And the girl at the counter was super rude not only to us but the people in front of us. Don't ask for water , they don't have water cups even if you order from this place. Zero stars, we will not be eating here EVER AGAIN!!!

We'll, first off I guess I need to ask what counter girl have you been speaking with? The girl that works the day shift is VERY friendly and jokes with many of the customers that come in. She has gone so far as to chase me down in the parking lot once when I left my bag of salsas on the counter. The food is always fresh and always a few notches above the other guys in taste and quality. By far, the best taco shop in Vegas! Love them!

Love the carne asada fries !!!!! The place on Jones has a better quality of fries but both places are good . 

I went for the carne asada tacos , I've only been twice and both times the meat is kind of dry and you have to eat it with some kind of salsa . Maybe it's the time of day that I go ? Because the carne asada on the fries isn't dry . Anyways , affordable and open 24 hours for the party people out there

Went in a few hours ago to order 3 bean and cheese burritos, 1 cheese quesadilla, and 1 chimichanga meal (all of which I've ordered before) NO TOMATOES! 
There were 3 men working, all of which were unfriendly and rude from the get go. I was friendly and commented that I love their beef chimichangas because they don't put any tomatoes in it, to which he agreed. 
I put a dollar in change in the tip jar and waited for food. 
Food came up pretty fast, all in a tyed bag, I said "this is everything?" He said it was "all of it". I said have a great night and they said nothing in return. 
I get home and see I'm missing 2 of the 3 bean and cheese burritos I ordered. 
With hungry kids at home I called right away and spoke to the man that had rung me up. I said that 2 of my burritos are missing (no receipt was in bag). To which he said "I know", then he tells me right after that "the machine told him it was only one I ordered?!" (Why did he say, I know??), THEN he tells me he didn't understand me...OK. He tells me that there is nothing they can do.... I said " OK...no worries, guess I'll have to just figure it out". He immediately said "who ME?", very defensive. I repeated what I had said. And we hung up.  
It gets better....
I just opened my chimichanga container and start mixing the guacamole and sour cream and see a couple pieces of tomato....
They not only put tomatoes in it....they put them in the worst spot, UNDER THE CHIMICHANGA! And a LOT (I have a pic). I've had to dig them all out of the worst spot. 
Why on earth would someone do this to a customer that did NOTHING wrong? I mean, come on. 
I've never had this problem before and I've never had issues worth the food before. This was done on purpose because either someone hates their job or they had a bad day. I don't know, but I'll never go here again.

I loooove this Don Tortaco. This is my GO TO place!

They are always friendly and welcoming and make whatever I want the way I ask them. Their store is always clean and I always see their workers cleaning or doing something to make sure the store is ready for business.

They're open 24 hours, so it's great to come any time of day!

I usually get Adobada Fries (extra crispy) with no sour cream or guacamole. It's soooo delicious. Whether I eat there or take it to go, they always seem to hook a girl up.

Definitely love me some Adobada Fries.

We stopped by to grab a quick bite. Service was friendly and I like that they offer a well-stocked condiment and salsa bar. The food was on the disappointing side. 

My fella and I both ordered breakfast burritos and the tortillas were not fresh and the size of the burrito was skimpier than I'm used to seeing at other similar type restaurants. 

I might stop here again when I'm in a pinch but I won't go out of my way to return.
